p: Parasitic confirmation (smears, rapid diagnostic tests [RDTs], or PCR) of suspected malaria is preferred, and empiric treatment is not recommended in clinical settings with good diagnostic facilities. However, diagnostic results must be accurate, timely, and available. Accuracy depends on the skills of the microscopist; RDT and PCR results reflect the performance characteristics of the assay. RDTs have high sensitivity for P. falciparum but can be lower for non-falciparum malaria. Presumptive treatment is not recommended, and facilities managing returning travelers should ensure an accurate diagnostic test result can be obtained within 6 hours.
